sprite.name: Red Coin Ring
sprite.notes: Red coins appear when a player jumps through this ring. Its prime use is to spawn red coins. When you collect all 8 red coins you will get a powerup.

value.title: Target Event ID
value.comment: Use this to link the red ring with the red coins it spawns.

list.title: Reward
list.comment: This determines the powerup reward given when Mario is small or super. (* This WILL crash if you're small...but only in NSLU)

checkbox.title: Shift 1/2 block to the right
checkbox.comment: This shifts the coin ring 1/2 block to the right.

value.title: Active Time
value.comment: Default value is 60

sprite.name: Green Coin Ring
sprite.notes: Gives you a chance to get a powerup.

value.title: Target Event ID
value.comment: Use this to assign green coins to this sprite.

checkbox.title: Shift 1/2 block to the right
checkbox.comment: This shifts the coin ring 1/2 block to the right.

value.title: Active Time
value.comment: Default value is 24

list.title: Usage Mode
list.entry: Only Appear While Event is Active

checkbox.title: Use Nybbles 21-24
checkbox.comment: Nybbles 15-18 are used if unchecked

value.title: Fly Distance
value.comment: In tiles

value.title: Idling Time
value.comment: In half seconds

checkbox.title: Start Rising
checkbox.comment: Starts lowering if disabled

checkbox.title: Horizontal
checkbox.comment: Moves vertically if disabled

sprite.name: Custom Door (unfinished)
sprite.notes: Inherits DoorBase nybbles.

checkbox.title: Z-Order
checkbox.comment: Makes the sprite appear behind Layer 1

checkbox.title: Doesn't appear in challenges
checkbox.comment: When checked, the door does not appear in challenges

checkbox.title: Debug Mode
checkbox.comment: Prevents fake actor from despawning when triggered

sprite.name: Task Changer
sprite.notes: ! Unfinished

sprite.name: Cataquack
sprite.notes: ! Unfinished + Requires model

sprite.name: Time Clock
sprite.notes: Adds or removes time from the timer when collected

checkbox.title: Remove Time
checkbox.comment: Time Amount will be treated as a negative number

sprite.name: Red/Blue Block
sprite.notes: Block which is active during a specific switch block color

sprite.name: Rainbow Light
sprite.notes: A configurable colorful light source

sprite.name: Debug Actor
sprite.notes: Actor useful for debugging various things

sprite.name: Kamiya
sprite.notes: A little mini-boss thing, partly unfinished. Make sure to also place Koopa Troopa, Para-Goomba and Mini Goomba sprites somewhere in the level's Area as well.

sprite.name: Model Loader
sprite.notes: Loads any model.

sprite.name: String Bank
sprite.notes: Stores an arbitrary 16 character string to be used by other sprites, uses Initial State as ID. Use layer setting for chaining (Layer 1 = Standalone string/First string of chain, Layer 2 = Second string of chain, Layer 0 = Last string of chain) for up to 48 characters.

sprite.name: Switch Block Event Activator
sprite.comment: This sprite is used in combination with the Switch Block (763)

list.title: Type
list.comment: Presets for surface types and other properties.

list.title: Surface Type
list.comment: Surface type to override the one set by the "Type" option.

checkbox.title: Use Surface Type
checkbox.comment: If checked, the "Surface Type" option will override the surface type set by the "Type" option.

sprite.name: Switch Block
sprite.comment: This sprite is used in combination with the Switch Block Event Activator (746).

sprite.name: Music Note Manager
sprite.notes: Spawns a clef that, when collected, spawns a bunch of notes. Collect them all within the time limit for an item!

value.title: Target Note Count
value.comment: The required number of notes with a matching ID to activate an event.

list.title: Powerup
list.comment: The powerup reward once all notes are collected.

value.title: Time Limit
value.comment: In seconds.

value.title: Target ID
value.comment: Set the 'Initial State' number of the target sprite to match with this number

checkbox.title: Safe Mode
checkbox.comment: Only apply to specific sprites

value.title: Safe Mode ID
value.comment: Target sprite/profile ID. Only applies when safe mode is active

list.title: Block
list.comment: * means that the option is unfinished and you probably shouldn't use it.

sprite.name: Actor Manipulator
sprite.notes: You can manipulate an actor's many variables. This actor can crash your game if you aren't careful. More info in the 'ID' comment.

checkbox.title: Event Activated
checkbox.comment: Rather than activating right away, this will allow you to activate using an event.

value.title: Target ID
value.comment: Deletes the actor with the same 'Initial State' number as this value.

value.title: ID
value.comment: The Sprite/Profile ID you want to target. Depending on the actor, some or all of the options below will crash your game. Sometimes, the crashing is inconsistent and random. If so, don't use this actor on them as they are most likely incompatiple with this actor.

checkbox.title: Delete Actor
checkbox.comment: Checking this will delete the actor.

checkbox.title: Invisible
checkbox.comment: Checking this will make the actor invisible.

checkbox.title: Inactive
checkbox.comment: Checking this will disable the actor's functionality.

checkbox.title: Change Scale
checkbox.comment: This will change the scale of an actor. This does not change its hitbox.

checkbox.title: Change Size
checkbox.comment: I don't even know what this does, let me know what this does so I can update this comment accordingly. -PoeDev

sprite.name: Move-when-on Metal Block [UNUSED]
sprite.notes: A tall block with a lava glow underneath it that will move at any point when a specified number of 'passengers' (players + enemies) are standing on it, then goes back to the original position.

list.title: Size
list.comment: This determines the size of the block.

list.title: Moves with Passenger Number
list.comment: This determines how many 'passengers' are needed for the block's movement to activate. Only seems to work with players with current research.

list.title: Direction
list.comment: This determines which direction the block will move while moving.

value.title: Speed
value.comment: This determines how quickly the block will move while moving.

sprite.name: Bolt-controlled Airship Platform - [UNUSED]
sprite.notes: Crashes the game. Tries to load 'lift_turi_ashiba.szs' but that file does not exist. A fully solid, airship style platform that moves down when used with a bolt. Goes with sprite 360.

list.title: Width
list.comment: This determines the size of the platform.

list.title: Speed
list.comment: Carry over from sprite 530

value.title: Bolt ID
value.comment: Bolt ID for sprite

sprite.name: Bolt-controlled Airship Platform Wire - [UNUSED]
sprite.notes: Crashes the game. Tries to load 'lift_turi_ashiba_wire.szs' but that file does not exist. A non-solid, airship style metal wire that extends upwards 16 blocks. Moves down when used with a bolt. Goes on top of sprite 358.

list.title: Speed
list.comment: Carry over from sprite 530

value.title: Bolt ID
value.comment: Bolt ID for sprite

sprite.name: Propeller Block [UNUSED]
sprite.notes: A block that went unused in this game, and lacks a model. Crashes because block_fly.szs does not exist.

sprite.name: Portable Ice Block (NSMBW) [UNUSED]
sprite.notes: Works. Uses the same model as the gravity-affected ice blocks.

checkbox.title: Frozen Coin
checkbox.comment: If checked, the ice block will have a coin frozen inside. (A bit glitchy when holding...)

sprite.name: Giant Koopa Shell Cave (NSMBW) [UNUSED]
sprite.notes: A giant koop shell that was featured in NSMBW. The grass and the shell can turn black randomly. It;s somewhat inconsitstent.

sprite.name: 4-Way Cannon - Crashes (NSMBW) [UNUSED]
sprite.notes: Crashes because 'houdai_rot.szs' does not exist

sprite.name: Giant 4-Way Cannon - Crashes (NSMBW) [UNUSED]
sprite.notes: Crashes because 'houdai_rot_large_B.szs' does not exist

sprite.name: Vertical Block Platform with Light Gem - [USUSED] (NSMBW)
sprite.notes: A 2x3 solid platform that has a light gem in the shape of a downward arrow. <font color="red">This block can crush the player so be careful!</font>

value.title: Return delay
value.comment: Unknown unit. Experiment and report your findings

value.title: Begin delay
value.comment: Unknown unit. Experiment and report your findings

value.title: Distance
value.comment: Moving distance

list.title: Speed
list.comment: Speeds are inconsistent

list.title: Direction
list.comment: This determines which direction the block will move.

sprite.name: Crowber [UNUSED]
sprite.notes: Purple bird enemy that turns around twice before swooping down at the player.

sprite.name: Line Rotating Mushroom Block (NSMBW) [UNUSED]
sprite.notes: Crashes due to missing 'cube_kinoko.szs' file. Also fails to load the model 'cube_kinoko_M'. This is a leftover from NSMBW that has code present, but the model is missing.

value.title: Target Event ID
value.comment: Event ID that will be triggered once player steps on block.

list.title: Starting Rotation
list.comment: Starting rotation, Tilt center is at the screw of the mushroom block

checkbox.title: Bounces Back
checkbox.comment: When checked, Mushroom block will not stop at line endings.

value.title: Rotation Speed
value.comment: Unknown unit, report on findings!

list.title: Starts moving
list.comment: Direction the block will first move.

checkbox.title: Moves Without Player
checkbox.comment: When checked, the block will not require a player to stand on it before moving.

checkbox.title: Counter-clockwise
checkbox.comment: When checked, the block will rotate counter-clockwise

value.title: Line Speed
value.comment: Unknown unit, report on findings!

list.title: Width
list.comment: it da with

list.title: Height
list.comment: it da hait

value.title: Movement ID
value.comment: Hook up to pivotal-rotation controller

sprite.name: Pivotal-rotation-controlled Colored Box
sprite.notes: This platform is used in one level in the entire game. It's probably used to help the shell collision in the level it's in, and it's completely invisible if placed in front of tiles.

list.title: Width
list.comment: This determines the size of the platform.

list.title: Height
list.comment: This determines the size of the platform.

sprite.name: Multi-size platform - Two way - (CRASHES) [UNUSED]
sprite.notes: Multi-size platform with unknown purpose. Crashes because lift_zen_kumiawase.szs is missing.

list.title: Direction Override
list.comment: Direction it moves

list.title: Size
list.comment: This determines the size of the platform.

value.title: Movement ID
value.comment: Can hook to 70 for sure

sprite.name: Rising/Lowering Bill Blaster (+) [UNUSED]
sprite.notes: A bullet bill launcher that can rise and lower, with various speeds! (+) The initial state flag is usable. IF set to 1, the blaster will transform into a bill.

checkbox.title: Upside-Down
checkbox.comment: When checked, the Bill Blaster will be upside-down.

list.title: Direction
list.comment: The direction in which the Bullet Bills are fired.

list.title: Fire at
list.comment: The direction in which the Bullet Bills are fired.

value.title: Movement Speed
value.comment: The speed that the Bill Blaster moves.

value.title: Height 1
value.comment: The blaster will start at the lowest height of 1 and 2.

value.title: Height 2
value.comment: The blaster will start at the lowest height of 1 and 2.

checkbox.title: Not affected by gravity and reverse firing
checkbox.comment: Does NOT make the blaster have gravity.

value.title: Unknown Value 19
value.comment: Passed on to child bullets as nybble 19

sprite.name: Rolling Hill with 1 Pipe (Enterable) [Crashes] [UNUSED]
sprite.notes: Diameter is 50 blocks. Crashes for two reasons; the first being the rolling hill's resources missing from the game files and the other is that the resources list in the code forgets to list one of the resources. To enter the pipe, you would need to be holding up instead of down.

value.title: Entrance ID
value.comment: The pipe will use this entrance's destination.

checkbox.title: Spin Counter-Clockwise
checkbox.comment: Makes the hill spin counter-clockwise.

sprite.name: Pipe - Left (Solid) [UNUSED]
sprite.notes: A pipe that's unused. Shares some nybbles with the 139 set, but not much. This one doesn't need collision tiles.

list.title: Color
list.comment: The color of the pipe!

sprite.name: Coin with Gravity
sprite.notes: Instantly falls to the ground,

value.title: Group ID?
value.comment: Hook up to a group controller that is also hooked up to a pipe with gravity, and it will move relative to the pipe

sprite.name: Pivotal-rotation-controlled Iron Block [UNUSED]
sprite.notes: An unused sprite that functions like normal. It's an iron block that can be attached to a rotation controller.

checkbox.title: Ignore Model Rotation
checkbox.comment: Makes the iron block still move on a rotation controller, just does not spin around.

value.title: Height
value.comment: Height of iron block.

value.title: Movement ID
value.comment: Use this to attach a sprite to a movement controller. Works with pivotal-rotation for sure

checkbox.title: Ignore Model Rotation
checkbox.comment: Makes the ghost house box still move on a rotation controller, just does not spin around.

value.title: Movement ID
value.comment: Should be linked to a path controller (sprite 100) or pivotal rotation controller (68, 69, 116, 118)...

checkbox.title: Ignore Model Rotation
checkbox.comment: Makes the ghost ship block still move on a rotation controller, just does not spin around.

value.title: Movement ID
value.comment: Can be matched to multiple movement controllers at the same time.

sprite.name: Brown Tower Block (NSMBW)
sprite.notes: A resizable block platform originally used in NSMBW. Be aware that you cannot synchronize this block for level-wide timing purposes.

list.title: Height
list.comment: This determines how tall the block is.

list.title: Width
list.comment: This determines how wide the block is.

list.title: Movement Direction
list.comment: This determines the initial direction the block will travel.

checkbox.title: Start Delay
checkbox.comment: When enabled, the block will wait two game seconds before moving. After the initial movement has occurred, this becomes irrelevant.

value.title: Tilt
value.comment: Value * 22.5. It tilts counterclockwise.

value.title: Delay Before Movement
value.comment: This determines how long the block will wait before making its outwards movement. Each value is equal to two game seconds.

value.title: Distance
value.comment: This defines how many tiles the block will move before returning to its starting position.

value.title: Delay Before Return
value.comment: This determines how long the block will wait before making its return movement. Each value is equal to two game seconds.

list.title: Speed
list.comment: This determines the speed of the block's movement.

sprite.name: Unknown Warning Platform (EXPERIMENTAL)
sprite.notes: Unknown platform that is in the code for NSMBU, but doesn't have any model. This sprite is also original to nsmbu, so there is no other info on this sprite.

list.title: Direction Override
list.comment: Direction it moves

list.title: Width
list.comment: This determines how wide the platform is.

checkbox.title: Doesn't Move
checkbox.comment: When checked, it will not move when hooked to a movement controller. (However it still requires a movement controller to spawn

value.title: Movement ID
value.comment: Hook to Two-Way controller or else it won't spawn.

sprite.name: Goal Mushroom House (EXPERIMENTAL)
sprite.notes: Crashes because goal_kinoko_house.szs isn't prsent

value.title: Movement ID
value.comment: Hook to Pivotal Rotation or else it won't spawn.

value.title: Target ID
value.comment: Collecting the star coin will activate this event.

list.title: Star coin number
list.comment: Use this to set the correct star coin number.

value.title: Unknown Value 16
value.comment: Goes up to 7.

list.title: Movement Type
list.comment: Set to the type of sprite you are linking the Star Coin with.

value.title: Movement ID
value.comment: Use this to match it to a rotation controller or sprite 70.

sprite.name: Group Line Rotating Mushroom Block (NSMBW) [UNUSED]
sprite.notes: Crashes due to missing 'cube_kinoko.szs' file. Also fails to load the model 'cube_kinoko_M'. This is a leftover from NSMBW that has code present, but the model is missing.

value.title: Target Event ID
value.comment: Event ID that will be triggered once player steps on block.

value.title: Group ID
value.comment: The ID used to chain sprites together. Use sprite 196 to create the groups.

list.title: Starting Rotation
list.comment: Starting rotation, Tilt center is at the screw of the mushroom block

checkbox.title: Bounces Back
checkbox.comment: When checked, Mushroom block will not stop at line endings.

value.title: Rotation Speed
value.comment: Unknown unit, report on findings!

list.title: Starts moving
list.comment: Direction the block will first move.

checkbox.title: Moves Without Player
checkbox.comment: When checked, the block will not require a player to stand on it before moving.

checkbox.title: Counter-clockwise
checkbox.comment: When checked, the block will rotate counter-clockwise

value.comment: Unknown unit, report on findings!

list.comment: it da with

list.title: Height
list.comment: it da hait

sprite.name: Ball Balancing Lift (NSMBW) [UNUSED]
sprite.notes: Crashes due to missing 'cube_kinoko.szs' file. Also fails to load the model 'cube_kinoko_M'. This is a leftover from NSMBW that has code present, but the model is missing.

sprite.name: Movement Controlled Silver-Gear Block - Crashes
sprite.notes: Crashes due to missing 'cube_kinoko.szs' file. Also fails to load the model 'cube_kinoko_M'. This is a leftover from NSMBW that has code present, but the model is missing.

sprite.name: Movement Controller - Pivotal Rotation (Swaying, Path-controlled)
sprite.notes: Link this to Movement Controller - Path (100). The controller will be the pivot (center) of rotation for the object controlled by it.

value.title: Triggering Event ID
value.comment: Use this to activate the movement once.

checkbox.title: Unknown Value 5
checkbox.comment: No effect at all.

list.title: Sway Start Offset
list.comment: Offset [Sway Direction]. Sway direction is inverted when 'Reversed Movement' is used.

checkbox.title: Unknown Value 7
checkbox.comment: No effect at all.

value.title: Sway Delay
value.comment: Delays the movement of the sprite when switching direction.

value.title: Swaying Speed
value.comment: The speed it sways.

sprite.name: Movement Controller - Path
sprite.notes: Follows the path by default in a "curly", realistic manner. This means the game takes speed into account and calculates a path that is roughly the same as the path you set. This behaviour can be turned off to make this sprite function more like in previous games.

value.title: Triggering Event ID
value.comment: Movement gets activated when this Event ID is set.

checkbox.title: Smooth movement
checkbox.comment: This nybble is separate from the "Move strictly" nybble and uses a different algorithm.

checkbox.title: Move strictly
checkbox.comment: Used to determine how the path should be followed. Elaboration can be found in this sprite's notes.

list.title: When the last node is reached

checkbox.title: Reset when off-screen
checkbox.comment: When the path controller is off-screen, it resets itself to its original position and waits for the triggering event id to be activated, regardless of the "Event activated" checkbox.

sprite.name: Movement Controller - Pivotal Rotation (Spinning, Path-controlled)
sprite.notes: Link this to Movement Controller - Path (100). The controller will be the pivot (center) of rotation for the object controlled by it.

value.title: Triggering Event ID
value.comment: The ID that triggers the controller.

list.title: Starting Rotation
list.comment: The angle it starts rotating at in degrees. Used to desync other sprites.

list.title: Event Mode
list.comment: This changes how events interact with this controller.
list.entry: Event Triggered - Rotates Back When Deactivated (Fastest)
Event Triggered - Rotates Back When Deactivated (Slow)
Event Triggered - Rotates Back When Deactivated (Slowest)

checkbox.title: Spins Clockwise
checkbox.comment: Makes the sprite spin clockwise.

list.title: Spinning Speed
list.comment: The spinning speed.

value.title: Unknown Value 18
value.comment: I saw no real change.

value.title: Unknown Value 20
value.comment: Sprite 390 is on steroids with this option used.

value.title: Sprite Movement ID
value.comment: Match this with rotation-controlled sprites.

value.title: Path Movement ID
value.comment: Set this to make the rotation pivot point move!

sprite.name: Bob-omb
sprite.notes: A bomb like creature that will explode after Mario jumps on its head or shoots a fireball at it. It will instantly explode when crushed or touches lava.

list.title: Type
list.comment: Changes the sprite's initial behavior. Actually, there is a difference between 2 and 6, regarding the internal bob-omb counter. Value 2 does not increment the internal bob-omb counter. This matters for example, when a cannon is placed nearby this bob-omb. The cannon only fires bob-ombs when this counter is less than 8.

value.title: Z-Position
value.comment: Used by pipe enemy generator

value.title: Bomb ID (Bowser Jr W7) [Useless]
value.comment: This nybble is useless, because the bowser jr type crashes the game. When nybble 5 ("Type") is set to 5 (Bowser Jr throws multiple bob-ombs at once), all bob-ombs have an ascending id. This is probably used to change the direction the bob-omb he throws flies, so they don't all go into the same direction.

list.title: Cannon direction
list.comment: The direction the bob-omb is fired by the cannon, when type is 3.

list.title: Pipe direction
list.comment: This is used as the pipe direction when type is 1.

sprite.name: Rotation-controlled Dash Coin
sprite.notes: A Coin Outline that can be rotation-controlled.

value.title: Movement ID
value.comment: The movement id for the sprite.

sprite.name: Bolt-controlled Airship Platform - Crashes [UNUSED]
sprite.notes: Lacks a file.

sprite.name: Path-controlled Lava Block
sprite.notes: A large lava block.

value.title: Type
value.comment: Valid values are 0 to 10. Values 11 and 12 will crash the game.

value.title: Spawn Delay
value.comment: Amount of delay before the leaf spawns. Can be set up to 4095.

value.title: Respawn Related
value.comment: Use values 0-3. See 'Spawn state' for more info.

list.title: Start Color
list.comment: value 0 makes the leaf bouncy. It only works with 'Size' set to Medium or Large.

list.title: Direction
list.comment: Controls the dirrection of the leaf

list.title: Spawn State
list.comment: *Value 2 only works if there are at least 4 leaves with this value present. Those 4 leaves will have to take up values 0-3 from 'Respawn Related'.

value.title: Sprout Delay
value.comment: Amount delay between the bud appearing and the leaf growing

value.title: Duration until fall off
value.comment: Amount of delay before the leaf falls off

list.title: Size
list.comment: The leaf's size.

value.title: Beanstalk ID
value.comment: Link this up with the Beanstalk's ID when there is more than one Beanstalk in an area. With only one, you can just set it to 0.

sprite.name: Kamek Boss Controller
sprite.notes: "Asset Tag Kamekkudemo"

sprite.name: Sumo Bro Boss Controller
sprite.notes: Only used in 6-22, of both NSMBU and NSLU.

sprite.name: Bowser Boss Controller
sprite.notes: Needs a location with location id 1, a bowser sprite, and something that triggers event id 7.

sprite.name: Coin
sprite.notes: <font color="green">Yoshi can eat this sprite</font>

value.title: Triggering Event ID
value.comment: When this event is activated, the coin will spawn.

value.title: Target Event ID
value.comment: When the coin is collected, this event will be activated.

value.title: Z-Order
value.comment: Use this to place the sprite behind or in front of tiles.

checkbox.title: Unknown Checkbox 17
checkbox.comment: Used in challenge mode only.

list.title: Movement Type
list.comment: Value 8 is used all over 6-23, but with no movement-controller attached.

value.title: Movement ID
value.comment: Can match to 70 for sure.

value.title: Coin ID
value.comment: Use this to link it to a the clapping controller.

sprite.name: Water Ball (Path-controlled)
sprite.notes: A bubble which players can swim inside.

list.title: Size
list.comment: Sets the size of the bubble.

list.title: Starting Movement
list.comment: Values change, depending on what the movement direction is set to.

list.title: Movement Direction
list.comment: This setting sets the movement direction of the bubble.

value.title: Moving Distance
value.comment: This nybble changes how far the bubble moves.

value.title: Movement ID
value.comment: Hook this ID to a path controller (sprite 100) and this bubble will move. Seen in some retail levels hooked to a pivotal rotation controller with no effects.

sprite.name: Path Controlled Rotating Coin Snake [UNUSED]
sprite.notes: I don't even know how to describe this. This is a coin snake of a specified amount of coins that has each coin rotating on a seperate axis

list.title: Star Coin Number
list.comment: The star coin number in the level.

list.title: Question Block
list.comment: Values 1 and 2 have expected behavior, but for options 3-5, the left-most question block has expected item, while the rest have one coin in them.

value.title: Target Event ID
value.comment: Triggers this event when hit.

value.title: Movement ID
value.comment: Use this to link this sprite to a rotation movement controller.

sprite.name: Event Controller - Brick Block (Rotation-controlled)
sprite.notes: A brick block that can be moved by a movement controller. Probably has a checkbox at nybble 13 that makes it spawn an acorn mushroom.

value.title: Target Event ID
value.comment: Triggers this event when hit.

list.title: Contains
list.comment: The content of this block.

value.title: Movement ID
value.comment: Use this to link this sprite to a movement controller.

list.title: Sway Constraint
list.comment: Values are not exact. Please RE the correct values.

checkbox.title: Swaying movement?
checkbox.comment: Only used on flowers that are on swaying mushrooms

value.title: Unknown Value 7
value.comment: This goes up to 7

list.title: Type
list.comment: Flower ty

sprite.name: Pivotal-rotation-controlled Brick Block
sprite.notes: Maybe checkbox at nybble 13 to make this spawn an acorn mushroom...

checkbox.title: Upside Down*
checkbox.comment: block position is one block lower than in editor

checkbox.title: Gyroscopic Movement*
checkbox.comment: incorrect block center.

checkbox.title: Acorn Mushroom*
checkbox.comment: When checked, the contents must be set to 'Nothing'.

list.title: Content
list.comment: Set the content of this block. It is assumed that you can make it spawn a Super Acorn by setting nybble 13 to one, and this to zero.

value.title: Movement ID
value.comment: Use this to link this block to a rotation movement controller.

sprite.name: Pivotal-rotation-controlled Question Block
sprite.notes: Matches to pivotal rotation controllers.

checkbox.title: Upside Down*
checkbox.comment: Does not work with Gyroscopic or Tilted

checkbox.title: Gyroscopic Movement**
checkbox.comment: incorrect block center. When this setting is checked, miyamoto will make the block extend 1 block too far down, THIS IS INTENTIONAL. The question block doesnt rotate gyroscopically in the correct manner. Instead of it rotating from the center, it rotates as if the origin is the bottom of the block. By changing the height of the block in the viewer, this accounts for this.

checkbox.title: Tilted
checkbox.comment: There is sadly not a possible way to code this in the viewer.

checkbox.title: Spawn Acorn Mushroom**
checkbox.comment: When checked, it will spawn an acorn mushroom. Contents mush be set to "Nothing" or else it breaks.

value.title: Movement ID
value.comment: Use this to link this block to a rotation movement controller.

sprite.name: King Bill
sprite.notes: One of the biggest enemies in the game, probably only topped by the Final Bowser.

list.title: Speed ( limited )
list.comment: {I'm not really sure about this.} King Bill's speed.

value.title: Delay Before Firing Tens (?)
value.comment: Every value is APPROXIMATELY 15 seconds. This could be entirely wrong.

list.title: Direction
list.comment: The direction the King Bill goes to.

sprite.name: Brick Block
sprite.notes: Just an ordinary brick block that can also be movement controlled.

checkbox.title: Spawn Acorn Mushroom
checkbox.comment: If checked, it spawns an acorn mushroom.

list.title: Movement Type
list.comment: Specifies which movement controller to hook to.

value.title: Movement ID
value.comment: Can match to 70 for sure.

value.title: Target ID [NSLU]
value.comment: Activates this event ID if struck

value.title: Unknown Value 5
value.comment: No visible change

checkbox.title: Place Behind Other Sprites
checkbox.comment: Unused; when checked, it will be placed behind other sprites. (1100 gives this result, 0x11= 17)

checkbox.title: Spawn Acorn Mushroom
checkbox.comment: When checked, it will spawn an Acorn Mushroom.

checkbox.title: Unknown Flag 15
checkbox.comment: Does something with physics when checked...

list.title: Movement Type
list.comment: Specifies which movement controller to hook to.

list.title: Contains
list.comment: The contents of the question block

value.title: Movement ID
value.comment: Known matched sprites: 70

checkbox.title: Regular Coin*
checkbox.comment: *Treats sprite as tile on layer.

value.title: *Movement ID
value.comment: This can be used to assign this sprite to a rotation controller, as well as to a horizontal or vertical movement. For rectangle platform, use "Rectangle ID". For mushroom lift, use "Mushroom Lift ID"

list.title: Movement Type
list.comment: Specifies which movement controller to hook to.

sprite.name: Bolt Mushroom Platform
sprite.notes: Includes bolt.

value.title: Sync ID
value.comment: Use this ID to pair this with a mushroom platform (that has no bolt).

list.title: Direction
list.comment: Direction the mushroom platform moves in.

value.title: Stretchable Spring Length
value.comment: Maximum extent of the spring "stem" under the mushroom platform, in blocks.

value.title: Distance
value.comment: Maximum distance traveled in blocks.

value.title: Sync ID
value.comment: Use this ID to pair this with a mushroom platform (that has bolt).

list.title: Direction
list.comment: Direction the mushroom platform moves in.

value.title: Stretchable Spring Length
value.comment: Maximum extent of the spring "stem" under the mushroom platform, in blocks.

value.title: Distance
value.comment: Maximum distance traveled in blocks.

sprite.name: Movement Controller - Moving Mushroom Lift [UNUSED]
sprite.notes: This sprite's inherits sprite 544; see notes for that sprite as well. This sprite is almost identical to sprite 544, except it can also be used as a movement controller.

value.title: Mushroom Lift ID
value.comment: Hook this up to the sprite which uses a moving-mushroom-lift ID

checkbox.title: Wobble Up and Down
checkbox.comment: Makes the mushroom able to move up and down.

value.title: Wobble/Stem Height*
value.comment: *If 'Wobble Up and Down' is true this will be the wobble height. If it's false this is the stem height.

value.title: Width
value.comment: Value + 3

checkbox.title: Opposite Sway
checkbox.comment: If this is ticked, the mushroom platform will bend in the opposite direction.

list.title: Sway Arc
list.comment: How much it will bend in each direction.

value.title: Speed*
value.comment: *Only usable without a movement id.

value.title: Stem Height*
value.comment: *If 'Wobble Up and Down' is true this is the stem height. But if it's false this value does nothing.

checkbox.title: Opposite Wobble
checkbox.comment: If this is ticked, the mushroom platform will go in the opposite direction.

value.title: Movement ID
value.comment: Works with Sprite 297.

value.title: Z-Order
value.comment: Possible values are 0, 1, and 2.

value.title: *Movement ID
value.comment: This can be used to assign this sprite to a rotation controller, as well as to a horizontal or vertical movement. For rectangle platform, use "Rectangle ID". For mushroom lift, use "Mushroom Lift ID"

list.title: Movement Type
list.comment: Specifies which movement controller to hook to.

checkbox.title: Unknown Checkbox 7
checkbox.comment: Limit 0xF

value.title: *Movement ID
value.comment: This can be used to assign this sprite to a rotation controller, as well as to a horizontal or vertical movement. For rectangle platform, use "Rectangle ID". For mushroom lift, use "Mushroom Lift ID"

list.title: Movement Type
list.comment: Specifies which movement controller to hook to.

value.title: Coin ID
value.comment: Use this to link this coin to a clapping controller.

sprite.name: Set of Green Coins
sprite.notes: A set of 3 green coins that spins around. Once collected it will spawn in another set.

list.title: Number
list.comment: Value + 1

value.title: *Movement ID
value.comment: This can be used to assign this sprite to a rotation controller, as well as to a horizontal or vertical movement. For rectangle platform, use "Rectangle ID". For mushroom lift, use "Mushroom Lift ID"

list.title: Movement Type
list.comment: Specifies which movement controller to hook to.

value.title: Movement ID
value.comment: Connect to path controller (duh)

value.title: Movement ID 1 (Rectangle ID)
value.comment: Links with 149.

checkbox.title: Desaturate
checkbox.comment: Desaturates the platforms.

checkbox.title: Moves Clockwise
checkbox.comment: Ticking this will make the platform go counter-clockwise rather than clockwise.

value.title: Movement ID 2
value.comment: Links with sprite 149.

list.title: Type
list.comment: * This is not cyrstalized. (Also unused.)

list.title: Counter-Clockwise Rotation
list.comment: The way the block stands (or starts when it rotates.)

value.title: Movement ID
value.comment: Use this value to assign the sprite to a rotation controller.

sprite.name: Boo Circle Boo [UNUSED]
sprite.notes: Normally spawned by a Boo Circle, these can also be placed as sprites. Will remain motionless, but can still hurt the player.

list.title: Boo Style
list.comment: *This boo moves up and down slightly

sprite.name: Movement-controlled Bone Platform - NSLU
sprite.notes: Platform falls when Bowser Jr.'s clown car hits it. Used with sprite 70 (Two-Way), but it might be able to pair with other controllers as well...

value.title: Width
value.comment: Value + 1

sprite.name: Data for Airship Hand ("Fast" form) - NSLU [UNUSED]

value.title: Amount of Lakitu
value.comment: Value + 1

sprite.name: Goal Pole - NSLU
sprite.notes: Only used in all NSLU levels instead of the NSMBU goal flagpole. Probably has to do with the 1-UPs Nabbit gets.

checkbox.title: Secret Exit
checkbox.comment: Makes the path when the level is completed lead to the secret path, and changes the appearance.

checkbox.title: No Castle
checkbox.comment: There is no castle. Mario will just walk to the right for a while and then stand still.

checkbox.title: Snowy exit
checkbox.comment: When checked, the castle will be covered in snow.

checkbox.title: Secret Exit
checkbox.comment: Makes the path when the level is completed lead to the secret path, and changes the appearance.

checkbox.title: No Castle
checkbox.comment: There is no castle. Mario will just walk to the right for a while and then stand still.

sprite.name: Seesaw Blue Mushroom Platform - NSLU
sprite.notes: An platform that tilts depending on the weight of the players standing on it. Includes stem. The option to make it icy can be changed in the sprite settings.

list.title: Icy
list.comment: Determines if the platform is Icy or not. This is always Yes in-game, but No is just regular ground.

list.title: Sway Constraint
list.comment: Values are not exact. Please RE the correct values.

value.title: Unknown Value 9
value.comment: Always used as 2

sprite.name: Super Guide Block - NSLU
sprite.notes: Gives all players NSMBU physics when activated.

value.title: Unknown Value 12
value.comment: Always used as 2.

value.title: Unknown Value 12
value.comment: Always used as 2.

value.title: No-Spawn Entrance ID
value.comment: Set this if you want the Dragoneel to only spawn if the player entered the zone through this entrance.

checkbox.title: Ignore No-Spawn Entrance ID
checkbox.comment: Don't care about where the player enters the zone? Check this!

value.title: Despawn Distance
value.comment: How many blocks away from the screen it needs to be until despawned. Value 0 means it never despawns.

sprite.name: Time Bonus - NSLU
sprite.notes: Used in the airship levels when entering the pipe before the boss fight. It is placed one block above the left hand side of the pipe top, so it might be able to give time bonus on duck.

list.title: Amount
list.comment: This many seconds are added to the timer.

list.title: Direction
list.comment: Sets the initial direction.

checkbox.title: Add return delay to begin delay
checkbox.comment: If this is checked, the delay before first movement is Begin Delay + Return Delay.

value.title: Return Delay
value.comment: The delay the movement starts AFTER the first run.

value.title: Begin Delay
value.comment: The delay the movement starts BEFORE the second run starts.

value.title: Distance
value.comment: Distance the linked sprite moves in blocks.

checkbox.title: Do nothing
checkbox.comment: No idea why, but this changes its state to a state that does nothing, just like when distance is 0.

value.title: Useless
value.comment: Used by Nintendo, but ignored by the game

value.title: Useless 2
value.comment: Used by Nintendo, but ignored by the game

value.title: Unknown Value 17
value.comment: Not sure

sprite.name: Grouped Lava Bubble - NSLU
sprite.notes: You can sync it with other lava bubbles

checkbox.title: Gyroscopic Movement
checkbox.comment: The rotation will be locked in place as it follows the movement controller.

list.title: Has Hinge
list.comment: The hinge will be placed wherever the movement controller is placed.

value.title: Length
value.comment: Value + 0. Value 0 = 1. Extends to the right of the sprite.

value.title: Movement ID
value.comment: Attatches to sprite 68 and 69.

sprite.name: Banzai Bill Blaster with Luigi Emblem - NSLU (+)
sprite.notes: Shoots Banzai Bills. Also has a nice Luigi logo on the cannon. (+) The initial state flag is usable. IF set to 1, the blaster will transform into a bill.

value.title: Unknown Value 6
value.comment: Only used as 12.

list.title: Direction
list.comment: Direction the Blaster fires in.

sprite.name: Upside-Down Banzai Bill Blaster with Luigi Emblem - NSLU (+) [UNUSED]
sprite.notes: An upside down Banzai Bill launcher. Has a Luigi logo on the cannon. (+) The initial state flag is usable. IF set to 1, the blaster will transform into a bill.

sprite.name: Bull's-Eye Banzai Bill Blaster with Luigi Emblem - NSLU (+) [UNUSED]
sprite.notes: Shoots Homing Banzai Bills. Also has a Luigi logo on the cannon. Shoots bills facing the player. (+) The initial state flag is usable. IF set to 1, the blaster will transform into a bill.

sprite.name: Upside-Down Bull's-Eye Banzai Bill Blaster with Luigi Emblem - NSLU (+) [UNUSED]
sprite.notes: An upside down Homing Banzai Bill launcher. Has a Luigi logo on the cannon. Shoots bills facing the player. (+) The initial state flag is usable. IF set to 1, the blaster will transform into a bill.

sprite.name: Spike - NSLU
sprite.notes: An enemy that can throw spike balls in a specified direction.

list.title: Direction
list.comment: Where the Spike throws the spike balls.

list.title: Model Facing Direction
list.comment: Direction the Parabeetle model faces.

sprite.name: King Bill - NSLU
sprite.notes: A much larger bullet bill that will launch towards the player.

list.title: Speed (?)
list.comment: {I'm not really sure about this.} King Bill's speed.

value.title: Delay Before Firing Tens (?)
value.comment: Every value is APPROXIMATELY 15 seconds. This could be entirely wrong.

list.title: Direction
list.comment: The direction the King Bill goes to.

sprite.name: Running Nabbit - NSLU [UNUSED]
sprite.notes: Nabbit just runs...in one direction. He ignores slopes, just runs in a straight line.

sprite.name: Snake Block - NSLU
sprite.notes: The only difference between this and 222 is that this one needs to be further away from the camera to despawn.

value.title: Target Event ID
value.comment: This event is triggered when the snake block reaches the end of its path.

list.title: At The End
list.comment: What the snake blocks do once it hits the last path point. Higher values cause crashes. Value 4 can be used to create looping snake blocks. To do this, make sure the path's start and end node are on the same position and set this to 4.
list.entry: Fall (Piece by piece - first to last)
Falls (Piece by piece - last to first)

list.title: Size
list.comment: This sets the size of the thing.

list.title: Initial Direction
list.comment: This is very glitchy when this setting does not match the direction of the first part of the path.

list.title: Start Condition
list.comment: That snake block will start moving after this condition is met.

value.title: Path ID
value.comment: Use this to specify the path the snake block follows. Only values less than 32 can be used.

list.title: Number of blocks
list.comment: This is glitchy when the length is longer than the distance from the first to the second node of the path.

value.title: Repeat-related Path Node
value.comment: When nybble 7 is set to 'Repeat movement', this value is used to get a path node with unknown purpose.

checkbox.title: Icy [UNUSED]
checkbox.comment: Makes the snake blocks appear frozen when checked. They're also slippery.

list.title: Speed
list.comment: The speed of the snake blocks.

value.title: Group ID
value.comment: The ID used to chain sprites together. Use sprite 196 to create the groups.

checkbox.title: Moves on touch
checkbox.comment: When checked, the platform will not move until there's a player standing on it.

checkbox.title: Stop at line stopper
checkbox.comment: If checked, instead of bouncing off a line stopper, the platform will stop moving there.

value.title: Length
value.comment: Value + 4 (in blocks)

value.title: Unknown Value 12
value.comment: Always 1

sprite.name: Sumo Bro - NSLU [UNUSED]
sprite.notes: Seems like a duplicate.

sprite.name: Blue Ring - NSLU
sprite.notes: A blue ring.

checkbox.title: Shift 1/2 block to the right
checkbox.comment: This shifts the coin ring 1/2 block to the right.

sprite.name: Sun Gleam & Bubble Underwater Effect - NSLU
Movement-controlled Star Coin - NSLU
sprite.notes: Might have a hidden nybble for star coin number (probably nybble 6).

sprite.name: Pipe Cannon - NSLU
sprite.notes: A pipe that fires the player in a specified direction. When entered, 100 seconds are added to the timer.

value.title: Unknown Value 5
value.comment: Must be 3 or lower.

value.title: Height
value.comment: Value + 4.

list.title: Firing Direction
list.comment: The direction that the cannon fires.

value.title: Unknown Value 9
value.comment: Always 3

value.title: Unknown Value 17
value.comment: Always 15

value.title: Unknown Value 18
value.comment: Always 15

sprite.name: Grrrol Passage - NSLU
sprite.notes: A rusty platform, with an end broken. The end that is broken is defined by a setting.

list.title: Cracked End Direction
list.comment: The direction the cracked end faces.

sprite.name: Movement Controller - Brick Blocks - NSLU
sprite.notes: Pairs with sprite 701.

sprite.name: Tile God - NSLU
sprite.notes: Exactly the same as NSMBU tile god, except the effect is placed a half tile higher.

value.title: Triggering Event ID
value.comment: When this Event ID is activated, the tiles affected by the sprite's area will be created/destroyed (depending on the Mode).

checkbox.title: Permanent
checkbox.comment: If this option is checked, the effect of the sprite (creation / destruction) will remain even after the event is deactivated. If this is not checked, previously destroyed tiles will 'respawn' (with their 'Block Type' set) after the initial event is deactivated again.

list.title: Fill Pattern
list.comment: Determines the pattern the area will be filled with.

list.title: Object Type
list.comment:
Here you can select which object type will be used to fill the selected area.

Note: If an event is activated that triggers the 'Tile God' effect to destroy objects, and the event is deactivated afterward, then the area will be filled with the object type selected here (the 'Permanent' checkbox overrides this).

Tip: The number in parentheses () corresponds to the position of the tile in the tileset (tile

list.title: Effect
list.comment: Determines the effect that is triggered when the event is activated. 'Destroy Tiles' can destroy all kinds of objects. It cannot destroy sprites. 'Spawns Tiles' will even create new tiles above other tiles or objects.

value.title: Width
value.comment: Determines the width of the area that is affected.

value.title: Height
value.comment: Determines the height of the area that is affected.

sprite.name: Movement-controlled Lava Land Block - NSLU
sprite.notes: Lava themed

sprite.name: Rotating Stone Gear - NSLU
sprite.notes: Doesn't need a movement controller to spin.

checkbox.title: Offset Rotation
checkbox.comment: Used to sync gears. Can only be used with large gears and is ignored if a movement-controller isn't used.

checkbox.title: Clockwise
checkbox.comment: Ignored if a movement-controller is used.

value.title: Rotation Speed
value.comment: Ignored if a movement-controller is used.

value.title: Movement ID
value.comment: Use this to match it to a movement controller (68, 69, 116, 118).

checkbox.title: Dry Bones On Platform*
checkbox.comment: *A dry bone sprite must be placed somewhere in the level or it will crash when this is activated.

checkbox.title: Z-Order
checkbox.comment: This will place the sprite in front of other sprites. The chains will also be in front of the player.

list.title: Width
list.comment: The size of the platform.

value.title: Movement ID
value.comment: Use this to match it to a swaying controller.

value.title: Unknown Value 11
value.comment: Only used as 1.

sprite.name: Event-activated Invisible Item Block - NSLU
sprite.notes: Might have hidden settings (like spawning an acorn mushroom). This is just an invisible block that is only present when a certain event has been activated.

value.title: Triggering Event ID
value.comment: The block is only there when this event is activated.

list.title: Contents
list.comment: Assumed to be the same as nybble 20 of sprite 61, due to matching value 12.

list.title: Color
list.comment: Set the colour of your pipe!

value.title: Length
value.comment: Value + 2.

value.title: Unknown Value 14-15
value.comment: Any non-zero value would probably show the same behavior.

value.title: Movement ID
value.comment: Oddly, 1-2 A1 used the swayer instead of the spinner like one would expect...

value.title: Unknown Value 6
value.comment: Only used as 1.

value.title: Unknown Value 8
value.comment: Only used as 1.

value.title: Unknown Value 10
value.comment: Only used as 1.

sprite.name: Arrow Signboard - NSLU
sprite.notes: Has an infinite spawn range.

checkbox.title: Don't Appear In Challenges
checkbox.comment: Some of the original levels are used in challenge mode. This setting makes the signboard not appear in those challenges at all.

list.title: Appearance
list.comment: Use this to give your sign board a fitting theme. Value 2 is supposed to be 'Big', but crashes the game.

checkbox.title: Is path controlled
checkbox.comment: Will forcibly disable "Affected by gravity".

checkbox.title: Place behind other sprites
checkbox.comment: Changes z-order to -2500 if the other z-order nybble is 0

checkbox.title: Affected by gravity
checkbox.comment: Will be forcibly disabled if "Is path controlled" is enabled.

list.title: Inscription
list.comment: Sets the inscription of the signboard.

checkbox.title: Use above collision sensor
checkbox.comment: When enabled, the above collision sensor will be set instead of the adjacent ones. Needs "Affected by gravity" to be enabled.

value.title: Unknown Value 16
value.comment: [1 bit?] No visible change. Only used in as 1 or 0. Levels: NSLU5-21A1 and NSLU5-17A1

value.title: Unknown Value 20
value.comment: [2 bits?] Related to "Affected by gravity". If that bit is not set and this bit is, the level will crash on Cemu.

value.title: Movement ID
value.comment: Bolt ID / Path Controller ID

sprite.name: River Piranha Plant - NSLU
sprite.notes: A river piranha plant. Needs to be placed half a block above the water sprite (88) to appear.

sprite.name: Question Block - NSLU
sprite.notes: Probably has hidden values.

sprite.name: Event Controller - "P" Switch (Blue) - NSLU
sprite.notes: Seems to be pressable by falling metal boxes, this may require nybbles though.

value.title: Target Event ID
value.comment: The switch will trigger this event ID when pressed. If the event if already active when this switch spawns, it'll be pressed from the get-go.

checkbox.title: Affected by gravity
checkbox.comment: If this is checked, the switch will be movable by the environment.

checkbox.title: Non-timed
checkbox.comment: When checked, the event will not be timed when it's switched.

checkbox.title: Shift a tile vertically
checkbox.comment: Shift the switch a tile in the direction it's facing. Used by the game internally.

checkbox.title: Owned by Clampy
checkbox.comment: Used by the game internally. Do not use this!

checkbox.title: Deactivates Target
checkbox.comment: When checked, the switch will deactivate it's target. If the switch is timed, the event will reactivate after the timer is up.

checkbox.title: Multiple uses
checkbox.comment: If this is ticked, the switch will pop up after a while, and you can press it again.

checkbox.title: Shift a half-tile right
checkbox.comment: Ticking this will place the switch a half a tile to the right. This is a largely pointless leftover from New Super Mario Bros. DS.

checkbox.title: Upside-down
checkbox.comment: If this is ticked, the switch will be upside-down.

value.title: Clapping location ID
value.comment: If you collect all tile coins placed in this location, a cheering/clapping effect will be played. It also takes brick blocks and blue coin tiles placed in it into consideration.

checkbox.title: Unknown Checkbox 18
checkbox.comment: Equivalent to nybble (checkbox) 11 of the Location-based Clapping Controller (Sprite 455).

value.title: Unknown Value 19-20
value.comment: Equivalent to nybble (value) 19-20 of the Location-based Clapping Controller (Sprite 455).

sprite.name: Para-Bomb - NSLU
sprite.notes: A Bob-Omb falling from the sky with a parachute. Note: These can still explode as soon as the land on the ground.

sprite.name: Metal Box - NSLU
sprite.notes: Spawns a 2 x 2 metal box without any settings applied.

value.title: Unknown Value 7
value.comment: Only used as 1.

list.title: Size
list.comment: The size the Metal Box is. Note: 1= 2x4 Tiles (horizontal) and 2= 4x2 (vertical)

sprite.name: Luigi Signboard (9-9, "THANK YOU!!" Sign)
sprite.notes: This sprite, plus 718, make the sign. Maybe one of them makes the player look at the screen quicker? And the other is the actual logo?

sprite.name: Pivotal-rotation-controlled Pendulum (Spinner, Ball 'n' Chain) - NSLU
sprite.notes: A swinging spiked ball on a spiked chain. Does not spawn if not tied to a movement controller.

value.title: Unknown Value 11
value.comment: Always used as 1.

value.title: Movement ID
value.comment: Use this to link this sprite to a rotation movement controller (68/69/116/118).

sprite.name: Ghost House Platform - NSLU [UNUSED]
sprite.notes: "All per polygon dedicated haunted house"

value.title: Chase Movement Distance (Down)
value.comment: Used with movement type 3. The urchin will move down this far when the player gets close under it and then up again.

value.title: Chase Movement Distance (Up)
value.comment: Used with movement type 3. The urchin will move up this far when the player gets close over it and then down again.

list.title: Rise/Fall Behavior
list.comment:
*Use this with Urchin type 2 to get the chasing behavior.

**Gravity doesn't work with Urchin type 0, with type 1 it will work correctly if the urchin is placed under water. Both types will slowly return back to its original move pattern if moved by something.

***Value 2 only gives the sinking effect to Urchin type 2.

list.title: Start Direction
list.comment: Used with movement type 1 and 2.

value.title: Movement Distance
value.comment: Used with movement type 1 and 2. The urchin starts centered.

value.title: Movement ID
value.comment: Should be linked to a path controller (sprite 100) or pivotal rotation controller (68, 69, 116, 118)...

sprite.name: Metal Box - NSLU - Narrower spawn range

list.title: Size
list.comment: The size the Metal Box is. Note: 1= 2x4 Tiles (horizontal) and 2= 4x2 (vertical)

value.title: Unknown Value 11
value.comment: Always used as 2.

value.title: Unknown Value 20
value.comment: Always used as 1.

value.title: Target Event ID 2
value.comment: Triggers this event when touched.

value.title: Length
value.comment: Amount of body pieces. Total length in blocks is (value+1)*2.

sprite.name: Spine Coaster (2) - NSLU
sprite.notes: Unknown difference from 699

value.title: Unknown Value 5
value.comment: Always used as 1.

value.title: Unknown Value 10
value.comment: Always used as 4.

value.title: Length
value.comment: Amount of body pieces. Total length in blocks is (value+1)*2.

sprite.name: Wiggler - NSLU
sprite.notes: Unknown difference from NSMBU wiggler.

sprite.name: Boo Circle - NSLU
sprite.notes: Boos forming a circle.

checkbox.title: Desync
checkbox.comment: When checked, it will desync the circle from regular ones. (Will not be the same as another circle.)

value.title: Outer radius
value.comment: In blocks.

value.title: Inner radius
value.comment: In blocks.

value.title: Number of Boos
value.comment: How many boos are in the circle.

value.title: Gap Position (Bitfield)
value.comment: Seems to move where the gap is where the player can go through. Probably a bitfield.

value.title: Pulse Out Delay
value.comment: Only used when the Outer radius is bigger than the inner. Delays when the boo circle pulses out again.

list.title: Spinning Speed
list.comment: The speed of the circle.

checkbox.title: Spins counter clockwise
checkbox.comment: If this is checked, the boos will spin counterclockwise.

value.title: Movement ID
value.comment: Hooks to a Movement Controller, but is hasn't been tested yet.

sprite.name: Brick Block (2) - NSLU
sprite.notes: Maybe a there's a checkbox on a nybble to make this contain an acorn mushroom.

list.title: Contents
list.comment: What the brick block contains.

value.title: Location ID
value.comment: Waits until a player is in this location until it rises for the first time.

list.title: Width
list.comment: The width of the geyser. (Value + 1) * 1.625.

value.title: Height
value.comment: The height of the geyser in blocks.

checkbox.title: 2 Blocks Wide
checkbox.comment: Ignores the width set, and creates a geyser with a width even smaller than width value 1.

list.title: Rise Delay
list.comment: *If nybble 11 (Height) is bigger than 14, the delay is 90 frames (1.5 seconds). Otherwise, you get the delay from this list: { 0 = 125, 1 = 123, 2 = 121, 3 = 124, 4 = 118, 5 = 112, 6 = 109, 7 = 113, 8 = 110, 9 = 107, 10 = 104, 11 = 104, 12 = 101, 13 = 97, 14 = 94 }. 60 frames = 1 second.

list.title: Rise Time
list.comment: If this is set, this is the time the geyser is risen.

list.title: Contents
list.comment: What the Brick Block contains.

value.title: Movement ID
value.comment: Use this to link the block to a movement controller.

checkbox.title: Spawn Acorn Mushroom
checkbox.comment: When checked, it will spawn an Acorn Mushroom.

value.title: Movement ID
value.comment: Use this to attach a sprite to a movement controller.

sprite.name: Autoscrolling Player Effect (?)- NSLU
sprite.notes: This sprite sets a flag on player actors, and deletes itself. It is still unknown what this flag does.

value.title: Width
value.comment: Value + 2 blocks. Maybe 2 nybbles...

value.title: Height
value.comment: Value + 2 blocks. Maybe 2 nybbles...

value.title: Target Event ID
value.comment: The switch will trigger this event ID when pressed. If the event if already active when this switch spawns, it'll be pressed from the get-go.

checkbox.title: Affected by gravity
checkbox.comment: If this is checked, the switch will be movable by the environment.

checkbox.title: Non-timed
checkbox.comment: When checked, the event will not be timed when it's switched.

checkbox.title: Shift a tile vertically
checkbox.comment: Shift the switch a tile in the direction it's facing. Used by the game internally.

checkbox.title: Owned by Clampy
checkbox.comment: Used by the game internally. Do not use this!

checkbox.title: Deactivates Target
checkbox.comment: When checked, the switch will deactivate it's target. If the switch is timed, the event will reactivate after the timer is up.

checkbox.title: Multiple uses
checkbox.comment: If this is ticked, the switch will pop up after a while, and you can press it again.

checkbox.title: Shift a half-tile right
checkbox.comment: Ticking this will place the switch a half a tile to the right. This is a largely pointless leftover from New Super Mario Bros. DS.

checkbox.title: Upside-down
checkbox.comment: If this is ticked, the switch will be upside-down.

value.title: Clapping location ID
value.comment: If you collect all tile coins placed in this location, a cheering/clapping effect will be played. It also takes brick blocks and blue coin tiles placed in it into consideration.

checkbox.title: Unknown Checkbox 18
checkbox.comment: Equivalent to nybble (checkbox) 11 of the Location-based Clapping Controller (Sprite 455).

value.title: Unknown Value 19-20
value.comment: Equivalent to nybble (value) 19-20 of the Location-based Clapping Controller (Sprite 455).

sprite.name: Metal Block Platform - NSLU
sprite.notes: The instance in NSLU 6-7 A1 with "0000 0000 0000 0000 0800 1700" is 11x3

value.title: Chase Movement Distance (Down)
value.comment: Used with movement type 3. The urchin will move down this far when the player gets close under it and then up again.

value.title: Chase Movement Distance (Up)
value.comment: Used with movement type 3. The urchin will move up this far when the player gets close over it and then down again.

list.title: Rise/Fall Behavior
list.comment:
*Use this with Urchin type 2 to get the chasing behavior.

**Gravity doesn't work with Urchin type 0, with type 1 it will work correctly if the urchin is placed under water. Both types will slowly return back to its original move pattern if moved by something.

***Value 2 only gives the sinking effect to Urchin type 2.

list.title: Start Direction
list.comment: Used with movement type 1 and 2.

value.title: Movement Distance
value.comment: Used with movement type 1 and 2. The urchin starts centered.

sprite.name: Snake Block - NSLU 7-6
sprite.notes: Unlike 222 and 655, this one can activate an event when ridden by all players if the 'Start Condition' is set to 2 (Only in NSLU. Won't work in NSMBU).

value.title: Target Event ID 1
value.comment: This event is triggered when the snake block is ridden by all players and the 'Start Condition' is set to 2 (Only in NSLU. Won't work in NSMBU).

value.title: Target Event ID 2
value.comment: This event is triggered when the snake block reaches the end of its path.

list.title: At The End
list.comment: What the snake blocks do once it hits the last path point. Higher values cause crashes. Value 4 can be used to create looping snake blocks. To do this, make sure the path's start and end node are on the same position and set this to 4.
list.entry: Fall (Piece by piece - first to last)
Falls (Piece by piece - last to first)

list.title: Size
list.comment: This sets the size of the thing.

list.title: Initial Direction
list.comment: This is very glitchy when this setting does not match the direction of the first part of the path.

list.title: Start Condition
list.comment: That snake block will start moving after this condition is met.

value.title: Path ID
value.comment: Use this to specify the path the snake block follows. Only values less than 32 can be used.

list.title: Number of blocks
list.comment: This is glitchy when the length is longer than the distance from the first to the second node of the path.

value.title: Repeat-related Path Node
value.comment: When nybble 7 is set to 'Repeat movement', this value is used to get a path node with unknown purpose.

checkbox.title: Icy [UNUSED]
checkbox.comment: Makes the snake blocks appear frozen when checked. They're also slippery.

list.title: Speed
list.comment: The speed of the snake blocks.

sprite.name: Player-Looks-At-Screen Toggle - NSLU
sprite.notes: This sprite causes Luigi to look at the screen.

list.title: Star Coin Number
list.comment: The star coin number.

value.title: Movement ID
value.comment: Links to a path controller. (Sprite 100)

checkbox.title: Don't Appear In Challenges
checkbox.comment: Some of the original levels are used in challenge mode. This setting makes the signboard not appear in those challenges at all.

list.title: Appearance
list.comment: Use this to give your sign board a fitting theme. Value 2 is supposed to be 'Big', but crashes the game.

checkbox.title: Is path controlled
checkbox.comment: Will forcibly disable "Affected by gravity".

checkbox.title: Place behind other sprites
checkbox.comment: Changes z-order to -2500 if the other z-order nybble is 0

checkbox.title: Affected by gravity
checkbox.comment: Will be forcibly disabled if "Is path controlled" is enabled.

list.title: Inscription
list.comment: Sets the inscription of the signboard.

checkbox.title: Use above collision sensor
checkbox.comment: When enabled, the above collision sensor will be set instead of the adjacent ones. Needs "Affected by gravity" to be enabled.

value.title: Unknown Value 16
value.comment: [1 bit?] No visible change. Only used in as 1 or 0. Levels: NSLU5-21A1 and NSLU5-17A1

value.title: Unknown Value 20
value.comment: [2 bits?] Related to "Affected by gravity". If that bit is not set and this bit is, the level will crash on Cemu.

value.title: Movement ID
value.comment: Bolt ID / Path Controller ID

sprite.name: Medium-sized Grouped Cheep Cheep
sprite.notes: Link this sprite to a Cheep Cheep group controller (sprite 616).

checkbox.title: Obey Backtrack
checkbox.comment: The Cheep-Cheep will not turn around and swim in the opposite direction when you backtrack.

sprite.name: Boo Circle
sprite.notes: A circle of boos. Can be customizable, does not need a movement controller.

checkbox.title: Desync
checkbox.comment: When checked, it will desync the circle from regular ones. (Will not be the same as another circle.)

value.title: Outer radius
value.comment: In blocks.

value.title: Inner radius
value.comment: In blocks.

value.title: Number of Boos
value.comment: How many boos are in the circle.

value.title: Gap Position (Bitfield)
value.comment: Seems to move where the gap is where the player can go through. Probably a bitfield.

value.title: Pulse Out Delay
value.comment: Only used when the Outer radius is bigger than the inner. Delays when the boo circle pulses out again.

list.title: Spinning Speed
list.comment: The speed of the circle.

checkbox.title: Spins counter clockwise
checkbox.comment: If this is checked, the boos will spin counterclockwise.

value.title: Movement ID
value.comment: Hooks to a path controller (sprite 100).

sprite.name: Huckit Crab
sprite.notes: A crab that chucks rocks.

checkbox.title: Blue
checkbox.comment: Makes the crab blue.

checkbox.title: Stationary
checkbox.comment: Makes the crab not hop backwards if checked.

value.title: Direction
value.comment: If this follows NSMBW's spritedata, all 15 the values here are different

sprite.name: Glow Block [UNUSED]
sprite.notes: Leftover from NSMBW.

sprite.name: Poltergeist item
sprite.notes: As soon as the player comes near this sprite, it flies up in the air and then shoots itself at the player's position.

list.title: Activation Distance*
list.comment: The block is activated if the player is within this distance in any direction. *Any other value than 0 is the same as value 1.

checkbox.title: Candlestick
checkbox.comment: Any other value than 0 crashes the game, it's the 'Style' nybble from Wii.

sprite.name: Decorative Candlestick (NSMBW) [UNUSED]
sprite.notes: Supposed to load a poltergeist item. Unknown why it crashes.
